titleStmt.title: In memory of the truly loyall, and valiant Capt. John George, late commander of Their Majesties frigatt the Rose. Being a full and true relation of a bloody fight betwixt the said frigatt and a Frenchman [sic] of war to the eastward of Cape Sables, latitude 41 and 50. On Saturday the 24th. of May. 1690. In a voyage from New-England in company with 2 mast ships, to whom the Rose-frigat was convoy. / By one of the company.

In memory of the truly loyall, and valiant Capt. John George, late commander of Their Majesties frigatt the Rose. Being a full and true relation of a bloody fight betwixt the said frigatt and a Frenchman [sic] of war to the eastward of Cape Sables, latitude 41 and 50. On Saturday the 24th. of May. 1690. In a voyage from New-England in company with 2 mast ships, to whom the Rose-frigat was convoy. / By one of the company.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and sold by most booksellers of London and Westminster.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Are all pens silent, is there none to tell".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
